item.title: sqldf
item.description: 1. What is sqldf and why would you use it? sqldf package lets you treat any data.frame object as an sql table, which means that you can write queries just as if you were using an sql database. Since the emergence of libraries such as data.table or dplyr + tidyverse, sqldf turns out to be fairly useless, so now it is rather a curiosity than a game-changer. Despite its uselessness, it works like a charm.
